item.title: Thomas add a quote by Baruch Spinoza
item.description: "Everything excellent is as difficult as it is rare." -- Baruch Spinoza

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Baruch Spinoza
item.description: "Chance is what we name something when we are ignorant of its cause." -- Baruch Spinoza

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "The two most powerful warriors are patience and time." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn
item.description: "Own only what you can always carry with you: know languages, know countries, know people. Let your memory be your travel bag." -- Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Lewis Mumford
item.description: "Our national flower is the concrete cloverleaf" -- Lewis Mumford

item.title: Thomas add a quote by John Dewey
item.description: "We always live at the time we live and not at some other time, and only by extracting at each present time the full meaning of each present experience are we prepared for doing the same thing in the future." -- John Dewey

item.title: Thomas add a quote by St. Augustine
item.description: "The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page." -- St. Augustine

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Robertson Davies
item.description: "A truly great book should be read in youth, again in maturity and once more in old age, as a fine building should be seen by morning light, at noon and by moonlight." -- Robertson Davies

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Thomas Mann
item.description: "What a wonderful phenomenon it is, carefully considered, when the human eye, that jewel of organic structures, concentrates its moist brilliance on another human creature!" -- Thomas Mann
